candidates.title: feat: Add lz4 compression support
candidates.body:
- Implement lz4 compression for both files and directories
- Update dependencies to include lz4_flex crate
- Adjust CI workflow to use Rust 1.88.0
- Update application logic to handle lz4-specific cases
- Modify command-line interface to support lz4 compression

feat: Remove lib.rs and transition to binary-only crate
candidates.body:
This change removes lib.rs and restructures the project as a binary-only crate.
The library interface is no longer published, and all functionality is scoped
to the CLI tool. Modules previously shared via lib are now internal to src/main.rs.

* fix: Remove i686-pc-windows-gnu platform

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=toml&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=0.8.23&new-version=0.9.0)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

candidates.title: chore: Update CI workflows and scripts for improved release process
candidates.body:
Refactors CI workflows and scripts for streamlined releases

- Removes redundant `workflow_call` trigger and `lto` configuration.
- Consolidates publish logic into a new `release.yml` workflow with multi-platform support, incorporating enhanced binary building and archiving.
- Deprecates `publish.yml` workflow and updates `build-all.sh` script to align with new targets.
- Improves release process by ensuring version consistency between tags and `Cargo.toml`.

candidates.title: feat: Add support for 7z, zstd and bzip2 compression format and update dependencies
candidates.body:
- chore: Add test-all script to automate testing across multiple targets
- fix: Update compression format display names and improve file name formatting in compression functions
- doc: Enhance module documentation and improve comments across the codebase

candidates.title: feat: add compression support for backup jobs
candidates.body:
- Introduced `CompressFormat` enum to specify compression types (Gzip, Zip).
- Updated `Job` struct to include an optional `compression` field.
- Modified `add_job` method to accept compression format.
- Enhanced `add` command to handle compression argument.
- Implemented `compression` function in `file_util.rs` for file and directory compression.
- Added methods for Gzip and Zip compression in `file_util.rs`.
- Updated `main.rs` to pass compression format to the `add` and `run` commands.
- Updated dependencies in `Cargo.toml` for required libraries (flate2, zip, tar, walkdir).
- Updated `Cargo.lock` with new dependencies and versions.

chore: Bumps version to 0.2.4 for new release
chore: Enables thin LTO for release builds
candidates.body: Adds "thin" link-time optimization (LTO) to the release profile in Cargo.toml to improve build performance and reduce binary size. This change enhances optimization while minimizing compilation overhead compared to full LTO.

candidates.title: release: v0.1.0
candidates.body:
- Initial release of hbackup
- High-performance, cross-platform backup tool
- Supports Linux, macOS, and Windows builds
- Includes CLI argument parsing and configuration serialization

repo.name: hbackup
repo.description: hbackup is a simple, high-performance, cross-platform backup tool written in Rust. It is designed to be fast, efficient, and easy to use, with a focus on performance and reliability.
